meanings.definition: Behaving in a haughty or superior manner.
meanings.sent1: She looked snootily at the other students in the class.
meanings.sent2: The snootily dressed woman refused to speak to anyone she deemed beneath her.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat snootily on top of the bookshelf, ignoring everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The snootily decorated mansion seemed to look down on the smaller houses nearby.
meanings.sent5: Her snootily raised eyebrow conveyed her disapproval without a word.

meanings.definition: Showing disdain or contempt towards others.
meanings.sent1: He spoke snootily about the new restaurant in town, claiming it was not worth visiting.
meanings.sent2: The snootily written review criticized the movie for its lack of artistic value.
meanings.sent3: The snootily laughing group made fun of anyone who didn't meet their standards.
meanings.sent4: Her snootily curled lip revealed her true feelings towards the idea presented.
meanings.sent5: The snootily whispered comments spread through the room, causing discomfort among the guests.
